events.originalText: Elvis on Tour, a concert film that documented Elvis Presley's tour throughout the United States, opened.
events.subtitle: Elvis on Tour
events.headline: Elvis on Tour concert film opens in the United States

events.originalText: Lê Quang Tung, loyalist head of the South Vietnam Special Forces, was executed in a U.S.-backed coup against president Ngô Đình Diệm following a period of religious unrest.
events.subtitle: Lê Quang Tung
events.headline: Lê Quang Tung executed in U.S.-backed coup against Ngô Đình Diệm

events.originalText: After being struck in the face with a hockey puck, Jacques Plante played the rest of the game wearing a face mask, now mandatory equipment for goaltenders in ice hockey.
events.subtitle: Hockey puck
events.headline: Jacques Plante wears first goaltender face mask in ice hockey

events.originalText: Dominique Mbonyumutwa, one of the few Hutu sub-chiefs in colonial Rwanda, was attacked by Tutsi activists, precipitating the Rwandan Revolution.
events.subtitle: Dominique Mbonyumutwa
events.headline: Dominique Mbonyumutwa attacked, sparking Rwandan Revolution

events.originalText: The Indian states Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, and Karnataka were formally created under the States Reorganisation Act.
events.subtitle: Kerala
events.headline: Kerala, Andhra Pradesh, and Karnataka formally created under States Reorganisation Act

events.originalText: World War II: An American F-13 Superfortress made the first flight by an Allied aircraft over Tokyo since the Doolittle Raid in April 1942.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: American F-13 Superfortress makes first flight over Tokyo since Doolittle Raid

events.originalText: American photographer Ansel Adams (pictured) shot Moonrise, Hernandez, New Mexico, one of his most famous photographs.
events.subtitle: Ansel Adams
events.headline: Ansel Adams captures iconic Moonrise, Hernandez, New Mexico photograph

events.originalText: Frances Kyle was called to the Bar of Ireland, becoming the first female barrister in Ireland or Great Britain.
events.subtitle: Frances Kyle
events.headline: Frances Kyle becomes first female barrister in Ireland and Great Britain

events.originalText: World War I: The first contingent of the First Australian Imperial Force (soldiers pictured) departed Albany, Western Australia.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: First Australian Imperial Force contingent departs Albany, Western Australia

events.originalText: The disposable ship 'Columbus (pictured) arrived in the The Downs off England, becoming, at that time, the largest vessel to have crossed the Atlantic Ocean.
events.subtitle: Disposable ship
events.headline: Disposable ship 'Columbus' arrives in The Downs off England

events.originalText: Byzantine–Seljuk wars: Seljuq Turks captured the important port city of Sinope.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Seljuk wars
events.headline: Seljuq Turks capture port city of Sinope in Byzantine-Seljuk wars

events.originalText: After Empress Matilda released her rival King Stephen, he in turn released Robert of Gloucester, her strongest supporter, thus prolonging the Anglo-Norman civil war known as The Anarchy.
events.subtitle: Empress Matilda
events.headline: King Stephen releases Robert of Gloucester, prolonging The Anarchy civil war
